text: Bottle at Johns. Courtesy of Rasmus. Region #104. Aroma of tropical fruit, white wine, alcohol, hop, citrus, pear and caramel. Heavy sweetness, light bitterness. Medium to full body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Enjoyed this.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are white wine, fruits, yeast, malt and hops. Nice sweet finish.

Aroma: Apple, pear, barnyard
Taste: Chardonnay, tannic, grassy, vanilla, harsh grapefruit, vanilla, subdued sweetness.
Mouthfeel: Heavy body, low carbonation
Appearance: Bright golden color, healthy white head

Great beer!
Fun beer. Like a slightly less good Orval. Wine like character, hoppy but remains checked, dry finish. Very solid. Lovely billowing pillow head too.

0,75 l bottle 
floral, raisin, spruce, citrus, hay, golden, hazy, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, long finish,

Shared 750 ml. bottle poured to snifters showing a cloudy, orangey gold color, with a modest layer of soft white foam, and spots of lacing. The nose was ripe fruit, citrus & stone variety, spice, and some woody/barrel hints. Medium bodied, with decent carbonation, the taste added some vinous characteristics, tannic & dry astringency, and some warmth. A nice upgrade to the base brew.

Bottle. Orange, peach. biscuit malt, dry lemon peel, and hay aroma. Hazy golden yellow with giant white head. Moderately sweet orange/lemon, biscuit malt, and moderately bitter/astringent fresh hay/lemon peel flavor. Nice body. Very good.

Bottle:
Cloudy, amber/orange/gold with a huge, creamy beige head.
Sweet oak, white grape, orange aroma.
Floral, candied citrus, oak, orange malt flavor.
Surprisingly delicate.....creamy, soft and sweet.
Excellent.

750 ml bottle from Trigs in Wausau, WI, opened a bit below cellar temp and poured into a Maudite glass. Well, a bit of it poured - it opens with a good pop and pours a bit gout of off-white foam, slow-decaying atop a luminous orange-gold, opaque body....I definitely get the chardonnay in the nose, which is vinous, slightly tart and fairly sweet, with a bit of oaky character and a fair amount of fresh doughy yeastiness; citric hops are present but never dominate...body is moderately sweet at the front, yeasty, moving on to lightly dry and quite tart, bitter and somewhat astringent towards the finish, with peppery notes and a fair amount of alcohol, though for me its only a touch too boozy and only at the finish - in the body its merely warming. Body is supple enough, moderately carbonated - just enough really to keep things light on the palate. I can see how the finish on this one would kill it for some people, it really is on the harsh side, but it isnt that damaging to me - enough to keep this from getting over a 4 I guess. The description focuses on the hops - which really arent all that apparent - and calls it a tripel; I think the current designation of Belgian strong works pretty well. My first beer from this brewery and state.

A huge foamer.......finally poured a murky orange gold and took 5 minutes to settle.......aroma is earthy wood, grape......taste is initially not impressive. Heads toward sour, but not quite, holds a belgian yeasty earthiness and becomes very astringent, not in a good way.....ignored it for 5 minutes and as it opened up the flavors went together much better, more fruitiness, nice malty backbone, slight grainy finish, continues to open with more and better flavors......advise? Let is open for a few minutes before even taking the first sip.

750ml bottle [10.6% abv]. Milky, orangey golden colour with huge, thick, creamy, mostly lasting, superbly lacing, white head. Vinous and fruity aroma, minimally bready and biscuity malty background, notes of dried yellow stone fruit, peach and apricot. Taste is initially moderately sweet fruity, minimally bready and biscuity malty, notes of peach, apricot, hints of honey, then the 87 IBUs become more and more noticeable with tremendous bitterness and citrusy as well as  floral hop flavours, notes of grapefruit, cautious hints of pineapple, a tropical fruity touch; on top mild vestiges of the Chardonnay BA add woody, tannic, fruity nuances with a touch of silica and white grapes: Creamy texture, gentle, lively carbonation. If I had been sceptical about the balance of an 87 IBU Belgian Strong Ale I must admit now: except for the first sips initial hop punch that nearly had effectuated a knock out, the malty backbone is optimally endowed to cope with such a disquieter. Rich, manifold, complex. Its not only that you find new solo flavour nuances with every sip - new combinations come to mind in addendum (e.g. peach-honey or white grape-sugar powder. Awesome stuff! One of the rarer examples using the PoMo craft beer gadgets (barrel aging, dry hopping) with an absolutely advantageous outcome at any rate [cf. e.g. Anchorages The Tide and Its Takers Triple].

750 ml. Gigantic spongy head finally settles down to a thin disc of cream. Nose is earthy oak with some spicy-sweet white wine, citrus and toffee. Tastes of white wine, apricot, lemon hard candy, wood and a touch of cocoa. Some bubblegum in the long finish. Medium-plus body is soft, lightly astringent and shows a nice balance. .

Bottle from Binnys Beverage Depot Glybourn, Chicago. Pours old gold and hazy with a lasting head. Interesting vinous aroma, contrasted by solid hop bitterness. Hints of berries, milk chocolate, wood, vanilla and citrus. Very complex..A wonderful beer.

Pours a hazy, sediment looking bright orange with thick white head. A strong fruit malt, grape and wine aroma. A sweet and wine like taste with fruits, malts, caramel, citrus and wood. A lingering dry wine and sweet fruit malt aftertaste.
B-. Pours a murky rust orange color with white head. The dry finish I believe comes from the champaign and I dont particularly care for it

Tap at Maricero.
Aroma: Orange, mikan
Palate: Full-bodied.
Flavor: Kumquat with white pine. Subtle wood note.
Comment: Served overly cold, so I couldnt get the most out of it for this tasting. Would drink again.
Tap at Imazato. Cloudy orange with lace. Nose is peaches, white wine, wood, biscuits. Sweet fruity malt flavor, peaches and oranges, wine and oak. Great beer.

Sampled at GABF 2015. In the tasting glass sort of an orange with a white foam cap. Nose is citrus and wood. Medium body. Smooth in the mouth . Flavor is mostly citrus thought the barrel aging adds a lot of character. Very nice.
On tap at Hay Merchant. Pours a hazy orange with thick frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is strong citrus, wood,floral. Medium mouth, vinous, fruity, light dry finish, very good.
Had on draft at Hay Merchant. Citrus, berries, malty, low hop character, grape, wine. Light oxidation in the finish.

On tap at Omaha Tap House 2013. Light copper color with an off white head and decent lacing. The aroma is hoppy and dank with a bit of grape. Flavor has some floral and herbal hops with even a bit of mango and and some oakiness from the barrel. Medium/full body with moderate carbonation. nice complexity to the beer and interesting.
On tap at FoBAB 2015. Silver metal in strong pale beer. Pours a clear copper color. Aromas of grapefruit and citrus. Taste is bitter and vineous. Refreshing.
Sample at Strong Ale Fest 2015. Comes a cloudy dark gold with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus, floral, and wine. Taste is citrus, floral, Chardonnay, and barrel. Nice.

Not as great as hoping. Chardonnay is light, but there. Hops are very light considering the name, assuming to allow for the chardonnay that is delicate. Very bubbly, but its not champagne so its odd. Tart. No aroma. Light yellow and bit of hazy. Bottle

Hazy golden orange with ton of foamy white head... Aroma of Chardonnay oak, butter, citrus, candi sugar, vanilla... Flavor is citrusy, Chardonnay barrel notes are very prevalent, bitterness on palate is much more mellow compared to original... Great beer


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours orange white head. Nose and taste of hoppy citrus, peach, oak, Chardonnay, lemon and alcohol - medium body

From notes. Enjoyed at the Great Taste of the Midwest on August 08. Recommended by Aly of Goose Island as we were talking about a number of things. The pour is a dark gold with a small head that just lasts and lasts. The aroma is heavy on hops. There is also a resounding dankness that melds well with all of the vinous grape scents that come from the barrel. There is a nice oakiness on the back end and a little spice. The flavor is also very hoppy for what I was expecting. The grapes and Chardonnay come through in force once you swallow it and its pretty well received. The mouth feel is thick and creamy, with a soft carbonation and a bitterness that just lingers. There is a little sweetness on the back end, but for the most part, this was just a great recommendation. Thanks Aly!

Tap - good size foamy head, dark gold color, moderate earthy hop aroma and flavor, fair malt backbone, definite Belgian yeasty kick in there, mild wine like notes, very good overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

At beachhouse in Bethany. Pours a cloudy gold with a fizzy white head. The nose is a yeasty bomb...can't say I find it pleasant. The taste is ok - Belgian yeastiness, some bitter hops, with some fruit mixed in - but, overall, this really is not my thing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at 2015 GTMW, pours a hazy gold with a light white head, the aroma is all over the place, spices mixed well with a hop touch and fruit at the same time, the flavor has a spice like front end with a good amount of fruit in the finish, not too sweet but hoppy too, interesting.

At Jerrys. Golly! A big beer in all directions, big belgian yeasty and fruitiness, big hops, winey, oak(although not a big as the others) and boozey. Could have been a mess but came together nicely. Serving: Tap

This is a huge. Had this as part of a draft flight at Jerrys in Andersonville. White head on a clear orange pour. Smells like flowers and apricot. Oak, wine, dry, dried fruit and earthy taste. Good brew

Bomber - pours kinda cloudy with a golden sunset yellow color. Smells like a yeasty Belgian style IPA - wheat, fruity, bitter light citrus hop, a hint of sour and some malty backbone that hides the big ABV. It is unique in how the hop is lessened from the Chardonnay barreling . The oaky fruit comes thru in complexity and body.

On tap at FreshCraft. Darker orange and hazy apppearance. Aroma of citrus zest, tropical fruits, spicy hops, white wine, light grape, light oak, tannins, peach and grapefruit. Similar flavor, a little funky and lightly tart. Complex and fun to drink with a medium to full body. Nicely done.
This is insane. I have never had a beer quite like this. Aromas of white wine, sauerkraut, rhubarb, lemon, barnyard funk. Perfect balance between sour and bitter. Wow. Flavor bomb right here.

750ml bottle into a Chimay goblet. Thanks to my cousin for the Christmas gift!

A: Pours a hazy amber color. The head is a one finger white shade. While its retention isnt the best, its both beautifully creamy and leaves a decent ring of lacing on the glass.

S: Very fruity. Intensely fruity, actually. Apples, grapes, pears, oranges, and grapefruit all intertwine on the nose, with a building bubblegum character coming out the more it warms up. The barrel character is moderately strong without being overpowering. One disappointing feature is that I dont pick up much hoppiness, apart from some of the citrusy characteristics blending within the esters. Otherwise, this is an excellent example of a barrel aged tripel, at least on the nose.

T: From the start, the esters hit the palate immediately with strong bubblegum, apple, and pear. Its on the finish where the hop profile makes itself known. Theyre more citrusy than piny, and thats good. The finish is also loaded with a clean oak characteristic - this feature is actually quite powerful, almost overly so. Wait not almost, definitely overly so. The toasted oak flavors run roughshod everything else when sufficiently warmed up. Getting past that, its a solid brew.

M: Surprisingly on the clean side, with the barrel characteristics doing a good job of drying it out. The tannins are a bit harsh, actually - its too dry in my mind. On the plus side, theres very little in the way of prevalent alcohol. 

O: Clearly, this isnt much of an IPA, Belgian-style or otherwise: the hops are only a slight addition here, playing second fiddle to the barrel character. This is a perfect example of an over-barreled beer - the base beer pretty much cowers in fear of the chardonnay barrels. Its a reasonable beer, but considering how much this brewery charges, Im having a lot of trouble recommending this one (except to barrel lovers, that is).

750 ml capped bottle. Dirty, cloudy bright gold with lasting head retention. Aroma upfront is mild white wine with a touch of floral type hops, traces of yeast. 
Flavor start with oak tannins, funky grape hints, and a hop blend that get progressively more bitter as I sip. Oak hangs around after the sip with the bitterness. A lot going on in this brew, really busy. Yeast chewiness with a dry finish. Lots of oak and Chardonnay grapes, honestly the hops are not present here, but a mild alcohol burn is.
Draft sample at FoBAB 2014 pours avg gold. Nose slightly dank, tannin, and hoppy. Some spice in nose as well. Taste similar to nose, but with more spicy character.

"My favorite in a line of really really good Nebraska beers last night. I didnt know what to expect from the chardonnay barrels as Ive had everything from mellow soft and buttery, to light apple, to sour. This had a light tropical fruitiness and a coconut aspect to the barreling that has been noticed in bourbon aged beers like Bruery White Oak. The aroma is tantalizing fruits and coconut, oak and hops. The hops are subdued but not covered by the barreling and their presence put this one over the top compared to the Melange (same barrels). Expensive, but soooo stinkin good. Mouthfeel soft and full and oh so smooth."
Draft at Maxs. Cloudy golden color, fluffy white head. Aroma of vanilla, lemon, light brandy. Taste is rich, complex, boozy vanilla and summer fruit.

Draft at White Oak Tavern. Deep golden hue with substantial head and ample lacing. Citrus and fruity hops with Chardonnay on the nose. Complex flavor profile with sweet malt, citrus, oak tannins and dry white wine finish. A truly outstanding Belgian style trippel...
Hazy golden with big white head. Musty white wine funk aroma. Slightly spicy white wine and funk flavors up front. Hoppy wine slightly tart finish.

750 bottle. Hazy pale gold with lacing. Tart banana bubblegum with granny apple nose. Mild sweet clove and apple flavors followed with spicey burning tart citrus bitterness. Than a wood vinous dryness. A very big complex beer. Usually this style would be more sweet. Very enjoyable and unique.

Tried during Omaha craft beer week. Chardonnay Barrel aged version. 750ml bottle only. This version of Hop God is a fascinating, big, bold Belgian-style Tripel hopped in very high amounts to concentrate citrus, grapefruit and floral aromatics in the nose. The addition of Chardonnay barrel aging adds further dimension and oak tannins to an already wonderfully complex Ale - bringing to mind tropical fruits and peach. 2013 Los Angeles International Commercial Beer Competition Gold Medal American-Belgo Style Ale 2012 Los Angeles International Commercial Beer Competition Gold Medal American-Belgo Style Ale 2012 North American Beer Awards Silver Medal Other Belgian Style Ales.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Maxs Sour Fest. Pours hazy bright gold with a fizzy white head. Tastes like strong pine hops, resin, old grapes, funky, musky flavor. Light body and medium carbonation. Smells like old fruits, grains, bready, and fermented.

Tap at Maxs Sour Fest. Pours clear gold with creamy white head. Aroma is sour fruit, floral hops, cereal and biscuit malts, light caramel, and light barnyard grassiness. Flavor is fresh hops and sour fruit esters forward with supporting dry malts and finishing dry with a bit of tartness. Medium body and carbonation.

Hazy orange with fluffly white head. A spicy citrus farmhouse funk smell. Taste is very spicy, black pepper, salty, some caramel malt, very little sweetness though. A little alcohol burn. Spiciness is a bit much. Not bad overall though. A little bit of the barrel character but not much. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle pours with a hazy gold body that supports a light tan head of foam. The aroma offers up Belgian yeasty spices, a mix of sweet apple esters and citrus hops. Pretty big malt sweetened aroma. The taste is similar where I get a mix of malt sweetened citrus hops, apple to ripe peach like esters and then it dries out into the finish with lingering hop and grape skin tannic bitterness. Nice.

Tap at Frisco Tap House. Pours lightly hazy gold with a large, creamy white head, long retention with excellent lacing. Aroma is Chardonnay, pear and apple esters, biscuit and honey malt, earthy yeast spices, light earthy and spicy hops. Flavor is moderate Chardonnay, sweet malt and fruity esters, earthy yeast spices and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.
On draft at Churchkey DC. Pours a hazy gold with a thick off white head. Funky nose. Flavors of Leno , tart green apple and sea salt. Smooth tart finish.

bottle,. very nice. goldenish pour. chardonaay really shows itself, grassy, floral, citrusy, lots of grapefruit. oaky chardonnay adds a lot of new flavor to the Belgian base. Peach notes, grapefruit, juicy white wine. nice

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2015 Everything about this beer is big. The aroma, the head, the taste, the finish. Before I get ahead of myself, let me take this one step at a time. The aroma is tremendous. The Chardonnay really comes through here. The head is tight and pristine. The taste is a complex phenomenon. Theres lots of citrus in the middle of the mouth, then theres a Belgian style fruitiness. Finally, theres that huge hop finish with a controlled bitterness. The flavor of Chardonnay lingers on the tongue for quite some time. This is an unbelievably good offering from Nebraska Brewing Company.

750ml bottle, shared by a local rater.. Mostly hazy golden orange color. Some fine particles in the body. Thin white head, some ropes of lace. Nice chardonnay oak barrel in the nose. Some grapefruit citrus. Bigger body. Smooth, sort of soft, lighter carbonation, lightly dry finish. Moderate to bigger bitter taste, light zest. Nice lighter warmth in the finish. Nice hoppy belgian strong ale. Good complexity. Enjoyed it quite a bit.

On tap at zenos. Slight haziness; bright orange/gold with white head and lots of carbonation. Aroma is pear, slight peach, and some oak. Flavor is the same plus some grape and a long fairly dry finish. Impressive, interesting, unique beer.

Draft at zenos at penn state. Golden color. Medium head. Aroma is tropical hop citrus with some oak background. Warming alcohol. Oak musk notes. Slight Belgium yeast notes. Slight sour notes. Overall is good.

hay, nuts, resin, grass, citrus, leaves, woody, alcohol, 

A solid outing from Nebraska Brewing Company. Smooth and drinkable despite the high ABV. Worth $30 a bottle? Maybe once in a while.
A fruity "belgian" aroma. Flavor is an odd mix of ipa bitterness and belgian sweetness with a dryness from the barrelaging. Color is cloudy orange with a white head.

Bottle courtesy of Ken1. Hazy orange with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, yeasty, fruity, white wine and moderate hoppy - citrus. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. Very Belgian indeed. 160813
Bottle from Bier Stein, Eugene. Pours a medium golden orange. Aroma vinous, Brett, stone fruit, effing beautiful. Body lively, finish funky, tart, citrus, just massive. Nebraska strikes again!

From bottle at 2013 Portland International Beerfest. Deep golden color. Aroma is of a citrus lambic. Taste is intense tropical hop, but incredibly balanced by the barrel aging, giving it a nice woodsy note. Quite impressed by how smooth and flavorful this is.

750, capped. Pours a cloudy medium amber with golden bronze edges. Dense creamy whitish head. Big bright lightly citric nose showing white wine, backed with nice floral and peppery/estery complexity. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Floral, white pepper, and lemony chardonnay notes on the mid palate. Could drink this over and over without a doubt.

Bottle. Tastes like an IPA sour--Chardonnay yeasts bringing the citrus flavor out of the 108 IBU hop flavor. Cloudy in appearance, orange color, thick foamy head that relaxes after a bit. Big mouthful. Lovely. Recommend, recommend.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap, clear yellow pour with creamy white head, smells Chardonnay barrel aged, tastes peach, apple sweet and and a tart aftertaste that leaves something a but funky, different
Sample at Oakquinox 2013.  Sweet fruitiness, mild citrus, muted hops, white grape, light oak, sweet muddled malts, and a bit grassy.  Not really my cup of tea.

Bottle @ Oakquinox 2013. Golden amber pour with a white head. There is a really nice fruit forward aroma to this. Peach, apple, and some pineapple. Floral hops, wine, bread, and a touch of oak. The flavor is a bit on the astringent and bitter side. Some decent fruit character, mild wine, and a touch of oak. Lightly grassy and floral.

Pours deep gold into a tulip.  Bright white head with good retention recedes to skim surface.  Oak and citrus aromas. Soft with sweet yeast and citrus upfront turning to grape and oak in the lasting finish.

A - pours hazy effervescent dark apple juice golden with 2 finger very fluffy head. The head is dense almost like egg white. S - you can smell the barrel aging sour funky beer notes when the bottle was first opened, Chardonnay, funk, salt. After it sat for a few, aromas were more reminiscent of a saison. Hay, floral notes, and citrus up front. Subtle notes of apple, barnyard funk, and soap. M - Drier mf, lightly sweet first. Spicy on the back of the throat, bitter and thicker end . T - interesting play the mouth. Very discordant, all the tastes seem to come in at the same time in different parts of my mouth. Jangled but not in the most unpleasant way. Sweet fruity notes and sugary malts in the front of the mouth. Chardonnay grapes, fresh orange, muted lime mix with brown sugar, simple sugars, vanilla. A long lasting bitter citrus and grassy hoppy burn linger on the back of the throat. At the same time subtle funky notes, ripe apples, Belgian yeasts lay on the palate. O - interesting but muddled. 3.7 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Le caractère de la double ipa met du temps à sétablir croulant devant la sécheresse du brett. Plus ça avance, plus le côté juteux ressort mais en général cest léquilibre que je retiendrai.

Chard character and the hop profile mingle to create a very rich aroma.  Persistent head in a tulip glass with great lacing throughout the entire experience.  Grapefruit, Chardonnay, mango, pineapple and other tropical fruits dominate.  Entirely different from the draft version

Beer 36 Asheville trip, draft at Thirsty Monk.  Hazy gold, nice head.  Aroma is lightly of funk.  Flavor is fruity, with some fruity hop notes (muted), followed by a bitter but winey finish.  Interesting.  Im a bit of a sucker for Chard barrel experiments for some reason.

[5034-20121229] 1pt9.4floz bottle. Orange juicy flesh and spent grains aroma. Hazy, dark orange body with a medium-lasting creamy off-white head. Boozy mouldy orange and tangerine peel flavour with a long fruit mould aftertaste. Medium-full body. The Chardonnay-barrel aging was an unfortunate process because I believe it ruined what was potentially an amazing base beer. Boooo. (7/3/3/4/8) 2.5
(c/o blankboy, w/ jercraigs)

2012-12-29. Hazy amber body, good sized creamy off-white head and lace. 3+ Vinous aroma has a good amount of the chardonnay barrel present, muted hops and malt. 7+ Flavour is similar, fruity, vinous white wine character, mild wood and wood tannins, moderate bitterness throughout, mild malt. Lingering alcohol in a fairly dry finish. Average plus bodied palate is pleasantly effervescent. The barrel dominates the flavour profile, and the hops are fairly restrained, I suspect a combination of the age of the bottle and the barrel aging. Quite enjoyable, just a touch too alcoholic at times. Bottle aged a few months, courtesy of Blankboy

Bottled sample via and shared with oakbluff. Orange in colour with a bit of haze and medium carbonation. Aromas are of oaked white wine, vanilla, and white grapefruit. Tart white grapefruit and wine are upfront on the palate, but a heavy malt sweetness comes through mid-sip and lasts through the finish. A bit heavy bodied, and not at all bitter. Not bad overall, and surprisingly drinkable.

750mL bottle, sent from tstockstrom (thanks a lot, Chuck), pours a cloudy orange with a medium white head. Aroma is quite funky, with quite a bit of white wine barrels, some funky notes, and subdued hops. Flavour is quite complex, with lots of vinous notes - loads of chardonnay barrels notes, lots of funk, not much hops left, lots of dry oakness, some mild peaches and grapefruit zest. Very complex and dominated by the white wine barrels. High drinkability, despite the intense white wine and lively carbonation. Excellent stuff.

Grabbed from Top Hops after dinner.  Ive been ton the top of Nebraska but never had any of her brews which has bugged me for a few years so I finally bit the bullet and grabbed this over priced bomber.  Pours a very dirty gold with nice white head.  Nose of white grapes, box wine, and herbal.  The first sip was sour and not great but once you let it breath I thought quite a good brew.  You get the chradonnay a plenty, grassy, citrus, yeast, vanilla, earth, herbal, woody, and light medicinal finish.  Tingly on the tongue and I was happy for large bottle as each glass I enjoyed more.

Hazy yellow golden pour, thin bubbly white head .... aroma of grapes (chardonnay), light oak, some light citrusy/floral hops and fruity belgian tripel yeast ...... taste has a spicy hoppy bite with a fruity belgian yeast, dry oak and chardonnay notes (grapes of course), citrusy fruits (apicots, oranges and peaces) and a light floral/piney bite .... mouthfeel is dry with a lingering bitterness in the finish .... a well balanced beer with abv hidden well

From notes..one of the top 3 or so offerings from Savor this past June, obviously this is not the ideal setting to be trying to take notes, but this really impressed, stood out from most other offerings, had a ton of complexity, and extremely drinkable..would love to see how this would age..seek it out..

My Bottom Line :  
Subtle iodine mars this Barrel-Aged Double IPAs citric and grape-y fruitiness, as alcohol heat and honeyed malts attempt to whip up a comforting brew.

Further Personal Perceptions :  
-A creamy head of foam covers the hazy pale amber.
-Hop bitterness is redolent of conifers.
-That aroma sure is not appealing, even more so for a style supposed to showcase bright hops!
-At this hefty price, you just cannot allow yourself to bottle a brew with any faults. Im not buying anything from them at this price again, thats for sure.

Bottle.

Bottle shared by Thorpe429. Thanks Mike!

The beer appears crystal clear and light orange in color. The head stands in at approximately an inch thick, and displays lasting retention. As the cap recedes it leaves a healthy dose of lacing on the glass. The aroma is really wonderful, with a lot of barrel scents coming through prominently. The flavor is very good, but not quite up to the level of the aroma. The taste is very tannic, as the wine barrels really shine through. The hop aspect is there, but is a bit overshadowed by the French Oak Chardonnay barrel. That being said, the beer is pretty well balanced, and surprisingly drinkable for what it is. Frankly, I did not expect to enjoy a barrel-aged IPA this much. The feel is medium bodied with a solid carbonation level. A blend of hops and barrels lingers on the palate after each sip. This beer is complex and interesting, and I would certainly have it again. Best shared and / or enjoyed in small quantities.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-12-2011

Bottle. Pours a golden orange color with white head. Malty, white wine, with hints of hops. Nice belgian, white wine taste with some bitterness from the hops. One of my favorite belgian/ipa combo beers.

Pours hazy golden orange. Smells of peach apricot oak and grain. The taste is smooth but extremely complex. Fruity white white, dry hay like hops, a nice full grainy feel. There is a beautiful Belgian golden ale feel that makes it familiar. Crisp apple cider like dry finish, very nice.

Pour out of 750 mL bottle, thanks to Aaron for the pour! Hazy orange pour with fluffy white head, dissipates pretty fast.  Aroma has notes of wine, white grape, some grapefruit, orange peel, hints of grass, peach and apricot notes, slight esters with hints of grapefruit, some biscuit and bready notes.  Taste is slightly boozy, hints of grape, white wine, hints of apricot, pear notes, touch of biscuit and bread, some yeast, finishing fairly sweet, slight bitterness.  More alcohol than I thought there would be.

Pours hazy dark gold with frothy white head. Aroma of oak and chardonnay are very present. Nice belgian yeast and light pineapple aromas as well. Flavor has a sweet malty body that immediately hits you with bitter hops that become immediately more intense and then smoothes over to a sweet finish that ends with a strong alcohol chardonnay flavor. The alcohol really lingers behind. This is a very unique beer. Ive really been enjoying all beers released from Nebraska Brewing Co.  I will say that all of their beers are uniquely distinguishable from the yeast they use to the oak chardonnay barrels...which is pretty cool to have a signature note to your beers.

Draft at Jimmies, YES I know draft of this beer is RARE but it came from a very reputable place so Im sure this is what it is. Poured a mostly clear dark dark gold body with a smaller large soap bubble mostly white head. Aroma of bad white wine, grapes, set bread and hint of wet oak. Palate is nice with a medium to fuller mouthfeel, stronger to average carbonation, good dose of heat on the finish. Flavor is the same as the aroma and loaded with vinous notes and green grapes. Meh....its okay at best.

Bottle shared at Slutfest 3, Richmond, VA, 4/21/12. Pours a hazy peach color with a thin creamy tan head. Decent head retention. Aroma of floral hops, earthy notes, stone fruits. The taste is stone fruits, bread, herbal and tropical hops, fruit cocktail. Full bodied.

Devgod opened a bottle while visiting NYC. Everything that you would expect in a nicely balanced Belgian-style IPA.  The chardonnay barrel adds a little oak but does not overwhelm the taste. Excellent beer.

Hazy orange color. Half finger head. Sweet wine aroma. Ibus hidden by the wine barrel aging. Not a favorite.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle.  Clear golden with a fizzy white head.  Very nice floral and fruity aroma and taste with notes of green apple, pear, caramel  white wine, vanilla and oak with a soft silky palate.

A little confused by the name.  Loads of chardonnay.  Quite a tasty beer.  But no hop taste to be found.  A little saison with wine all over it.  Buttery and slick.  Would get a better rating if they left the hop name out of it.

Pretty nice looking, orange-ish tan colored and mostly clear, fairly good white head and not bad lace.  Smell is very sour-like, notable chardonnay and wood, malt and hops arent as strong as I suspected but make a nice appearance.  Tastes like a kind of strange, earthy sour. Hops are noticeable but Im not sure why this is a "God" of the hop.  Definitely woody notes. A good malt base that makes it enjoyable and tries to balance out the kind of overbearing barrel aging. You kind of catch the hops on the backbite, second half of the swig.  Body is smooth and luscious, very enjoyable, especially as it warmed. Pretty thick and full bodied despite the color and style. Mild tang and warming from the alcohol. Bitterness is pretty high but is somewhat masked by a sweet finish.  Its quite likeable, though a bit odd and Im not sure what style/category it should really be in. However, if you like sours or you like chardonnay (as I like both a lot), definitely try this one for a special occasion sometime, with sophisticated beer drinkers ONLY. If youre expecting some kind of bold IPA you will probably be disappointed.

Expensive 750 ml. bottle.  Pours an opaque orangish caramel.  Slightly offwhite, sticky white head.  Aroma of apricot, strong belgian yeast esters, citrus, some caramel.  Mild barrel and chardonay notes.  Flavor of grapefruit, tangerine, orange, fruity esters.  Mild caramel, fairly dry and delicious.  Pretty nice, actually, one of the better attenuated "Belgian" IPAs Ive had in a long time.  Nice carbonation, medium bodied, finishes on a dry tropical fruit note.  Some chardonay notes.  Pretty nice, definitely one of the better Belgian IPAs Ive ever had.

Sample from 750 ml bottle (from notes).  Pours a hazy golden orange color with a medium sized fluffy off white head.  The aroma had ample notes of citrus and florals, more subtle woody, vanilla and sweet malts.  The flavor offers citrus and subtle peach, vanilla, oak, some tannins and sweeter malts.  Medium body;mild bitterness to the finish, very interesting beer.  This was a one time taste and I would love to try this again to compare notes.

Location/Date:Bottle shared on November 24th with Dave.
Appearance: Pours a dark copperish color.
Aroma: Aroma is fruity, malty..
Taste:Malty to start, sweet, then oak on the finish.
Palate:Medium light body.
Summary: A really interesting beer.

I thought this was fantastic.  You get a lot from the oak barrels.  Its somewhat thick and sweet and very very dry from the aging.  Lots of oakiness.  The barrel aging imparts something of a saison character to what is already a very good tripel.  Highly recommended.

Beer has a variety of textures and tastes. The chardonnay oak barrels seem to compete with the yeast and hops from this peculiar style. Very layered though, the nice thing about this beer is it acts like the wine it was barrel aged from. The taste unfolds at the end with a yeasty sour finish, but the first taste that hits my mouth is the crisp buttery notes indicative to chardonnay.
Pours murky golden orange with a white head. Aroma is malty, citrus, yeasty spice, and brett. Flavor is sweet, fruity, citrus, green apple, woody, horseblanket, and  a good bit of hoppy bitterness.

3/5/11 bottle at rbwg.

pale orange with a small white head.

a= belgo yeast meets lemon, white white and dank hops.

the flavor is a bit hot... lots of barrel qualities, wine, mild tannins and bitter hoppiness. odd but pretty dece. 7/3/7/3/15

750ml bottle. Rating #82. Hazy bright orange pour with a nice white head. Intense aroma, yeasty, spicy and hoppy all in one big aromatic explosion. Nice big flavor as well, moderate bitterness, a little woody with a nice little spicy kick. Really nice beer. (1981)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text:
Pours a dark golden orange color with a 1.5 finger frothy white head that has good retention, only slowly fading into a lasting ring.  Spots of soapy lacing left behind.  

Slightly earthy hop aroma with hints of grass and pine countered by sweet citrus and other light fruit.  Slight alcohol presence and light fruit from the Belgian yeast.  Hints of apple and pear along with slight lemon.  Subtle earthy oak with a prominent vinous/white wine character that compliments the fruit notes nicely.  

Medium bodied but on the fuller end with a blast of dry earthy hops up front that linger over the earthy oak and sweet fruit notes into a slightly dry, lingering finish.  Hints of pine needle as well as some prominent lemon citrus and apple flavor.  The barrel presence is pretty strong with notes of dry toasted oak and a powerful vinous white wine character. Lots of vinous grape and white wine which compliments the fruit from the hops and Belgian yeast.  Subtle alcohol but easy to drink with decently masked ABV.  Hops complimented by oak/barrel and citrus complimented by estery fruit notes.  Pretty good.

A very nice and intense beer, though it seems a little muddled with too much going on. Aroma was nice. Strong Belgian yeast and pear with a heavy hop presence to it. Pour was a nice bubbly medium gold with a one finger white head. Taste was either very complex or just plain muddled with all the flavors fighting for dominance. Heavy wine flavors (pear, apple and grape) in the front with a very wet bitter hop aftertaste. All the while the strong Belgian yeast is biting the cheeks and drying the back of the throat. The aftertaste is a strong combination of all 3 flavors. As it warmed, it melded a little better. Nice carbonation round the beer out.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Hazy orange pour with creamy white head and lace. Bready, light resin, vanilla, and a hinto abv.  Bourbon barrell, bready, caramel malt, and a light sour. Medium boded with a bito fizz.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2013 one of the best things Ive ever put into my mouth, and yes, I AM counting David Bowie, too.

Incredible caramel-apricot color, hazy and gold laced. Three fingers of slightly off-white tightly carbonated head. Great retention and rocky dissipation.

Aroma screams of chardonnay, green apples, apricot, tangy yeast, and some moderate hops. Oak and grapes are prevalent.

Taste follows aroma, but much more oaky-butteriness and slight grape acidity. I cant tell you how lively this flavor is. Finishes with a serious hop dryness and bitterness on the sides and back of the tongue. Dry hop flavor, not citrussy.

One of the best beers Ive ever tasted. Top 3, hands down. My first Nebraska, and definitely not to be the last. WORTH EVERY GOD-DAMNED RED CENT! POSSIBLY THE BEST BEER IN AMERICA.

Bottle shared by a friend. Hazy gold pour with a thick white head. Malty and estery nose with bitter grassy hop notes and some white wine character. Winey flavor before banana Belgian esters take over, then grassy hops show up for a bit before a boozy finish. Interesting beer, but nowhere near worth the asking price.

750ml bottle. pours a nice murky golden color. nice aroma but nothing that stood out as a big IPA. interesting taste of citrusy hops  and slightly sour on the finish. Im told this is from the chard barrel aging. Good beer but hard to justify the price tag.

Nice blend of cherry, apple, and pear aromas. Cloudy amber, little head. Flavor is triple sec up front with oak and maraschino cherry notes also present. There is also an impression of brett, but my glass may have just needed a rinse.  This is a big beer with quite a bit of heat. Tasty, but Im beginning to tire of these big sorts of beers and wouldnt want more than one.

Bottle. Pours an orange color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity hoppy bitter aroma with weak yeasty hints. Fruity malty hoppy yeasty barrel flavor. Has a fruity malty hoppy bitter finish with hints of wood in the aftertaste.
They do indeed have this on tap very rarely. Ridiculously expensive 4 oz pour. It is pretty tasty, notes of wine, oak, yeasty spice, and a hint of hops.

Poor is hazy yellow with small head. Aroma is tart lemon rind with honey taste is kind all over the place a little tart up front. Then vanilla and white pepper followed by oak  leather and finish is slightly bitter good beer. Thx tally beer.

8/5/11. 750mL bottle thanks to Tim and Rachel! Very cloudy orangeish pour with a small off-white head. Complex aroma with oak, sour, vanilla, wine, and more... awesome flavor that contains big oak, vanilla, a touch of sour, hops, wine, and more. Ths is good shit!

750 mL bottle shared at the July Santa Cruz tasting. Pours a hazy brass color with a light-tan head. Aroma is pretty much pure chardonnay, not getting a lot of IPA or even beer character out of it. Big apple/pear, perfume and alcohol. Flavor is buttery oak up front, then a winey fruitiness, some round esters and yeastiness and a tannic, bitter finish. Comes together pretty nicely but its not very recognizable as an IPA of any sort.

Bottled. An unclear golden beer with a lazing off-white head. The aroma has notes of hops and grapefruits. The flavor is sweet with notes of lemon, malt, grapefruit, and alcohol, leading to a dry finish.

In short: Topical fruits, white wine barrels, rustic dank cellar and a ton of grapefruity/lemony hops.  Excellent and unique.
How: Bottle 750ml.  Consumed one month after purchase but this kind of fancy pricey bottle may have been sitting there for 6 months.
The look: Cloudy golden blonde body topped by a medium off-white head with medium retention
In long: Nose has plenty of white wine barrels, tropical fruits, freshly cut grass.  Overall there was something about the aroma that I would describe as dank cellar that gave the beer aroma a bit of a rustic semi-wild edge.  Very intriguing aroma.  Taste is an original mix of white wine barrel aged blonde Belgian ale with a whole lot of high-alpha-acid grapefruity and lemony American hops.  The wine barrels were perfectly integrated and didnt grab all the palate attention, plenty of pineapples and other tropical fruits as well as some yellow not-too-ripe bananas.  Also some countryside flowers.  The biting bitter grapefruity/lemony hops were almost overwhelming and reminded me of the Port Brewing Mongo that I had the a few days before.  This is a great original beer.  The only problem with this beer is the price, but I bought a bottle anyway because I treat each day as if it was my only day on earth.  Just in case I woke up a mayfly and I didnt realize.
@RBWG-750ml bottle-thanks to fata2683pours an off white head and cloudy gold color.  Aroma is yeast, spice, light/medium malt, tart.  Taste is yeast, spice, light/medium malt, tart.
Shared by fata2683 at RBWG. Pours a golden with a whtie head. Aroma is wine, hops, yeast. Flavor is yeasts, hops, wine, citrus and loads of tropical flavors. Really nice, thanks Keith.
Clear light amber color/ ivory head. Nice wet wood, tropical fruit, citrus aromas. Medium body. Good fruity sweet pale malt, belgian yeast flavors with wet wood, white grapes--
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: 750 ml bottle from michael-pollack- thanks again, Pollack! Pours a semi-cloudy gold color with a small white head. Aroma of white grapes, oak, sweet malts, citrus, peaches, butter, and faint farmhouse funk. Flavor of sweet malts, honey, oak, grapes, grassy hops, straw, and barnyard funk. Medium-bodied, with mellow carbonation and a chewy, funky mouthfeel. Im excited that Nebraska stuff is now coming to Missouri because everything Ive had so far has been really outstanding.

750 ml bottle shared by adneilson (thanks AAron) poured a clear amber with a lasting creamy ivory head. Aromas of yeast, pear, wjite grapesa, straw, light orange and light grapefruit. Palate was medium bodied and smooth with a dry finiush. Flavors of yeast, pear, white grapes, straw, grapefruit and light orange with a smooth dry lingering bitter finish.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2012 Bottle @ ratmans house. Mildly hazy, yellow-orange appearance with a lively, white foamy head. Delicious tropical fruity, mango, grapefruit, pineapple, somewhat herbal, a bit spicy yeasty, white wine aroma. Very appealing nose. Dry, chardonnay, vinous, mango, apricot, peach, grapefruit, fruity, somewhat earthy, herbal, tangy flavor with some booze on the finish.

Sampled @ RBWG. Really not sure who brought this...thanks for whomever did!!! Hazy 14 karat pour with a small ivory head that left a spot or two of lacing. Quite sweet both in aroma and flavor. Bit of tropical fruit, biscuit, and yeast in the nose. Flavor is similar with lemongrass, Belgian yeast, and caramel malt. Medium mouthfeel...expected heavier, brighter, even surprisingly bitter hops and just didnt get it. Bit of a miss for me.

Huge thanks to welosiped for getting this bottle out to me. Served in a snifter.

Pours a moderately-hazed orange-copper color with a nice white head and a bit of lacing as it falls. The nose brings some tropical and citrus fruits plus a good dose of oak and chadonnay. The taste is quite the improvement with some nice hop flavor and a bit of grape skin and oak. Finish is quite bitter with some nice oak tannins filling things out. Medium body. Overall, quite drinkable and certainly one of the best, if not the best, barrel-aged IPAs that Ive come across.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-14-2011

Poured in a tulip glass.  Very cloudy golden, sort of orangish color.  Lots of lacing on the glass.

I smell the Chardonnay right away.  Hints of the oak in there.  Then Belgian like esters.

The Chardonnay and oak are tasted right away.  A lot of Belgian influence.  Very dry finish.

Bottle: Poured a deep hazy dirty blonde color ale with a large off-white foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma is a complex mix between a dry hoppy Belgian ale with some sweet notes mix with some light tart vinous notes. Taste is quite complex with notes of sweet Belgian style malt with dry hoppy notes and light tart vinous notes. A bit lacking balanced with more vinous notes would have been better. Body is quite full with good carbonation and no apparent alcohol. Very interesting experience though maybe lacking a bit of balance.

Bottle thanks to ericandersnavy. Pours a hazy gold with creamy beige head. Aroma has some buttery/white grape chardonnay notes, light oak, fruit, floral hop, subtle farmhouse and light malt. Flavor is very much the same. Mouthfeel is medium, soft body with fizzy carbonation. Overall, very elegant and tasty!

Bottle provided by Alex over dinner...Pours a dark hazy peach with an off white head that good retention and nice streaky lacing...The aroma has a lot going on, tons of belgian yeast, oak, wine, and a bretty funk...The taste is very vinous, immediately I think Im drinking wine, its very dry and has the feel of a chardonnay. The taste is a mix-mash of yeast, oak, and brett, has a sharp acidic bite Im not a huge fan of. Interesting profile but not a flavor I enjoy. Its actually tough to describe it but oak, yeast and bret mixed tougher with a glass of wine gets you on the right path.

Too much going on, I wouldnt drink this again or recommend it.
sampled during the 2011 RBWG weekend  pours hazy gold with a thick white head.  Aroma is vinous and full of stale wood and leather.  Flavor is super dry, loads of hops, dry yeast notes.  Interesting

Outstanding craftmanship.Wafting wine and hops.  Looks great though a light colour. Full mouthfeel.  Very satisfying, with the patience of 6 months of barrel ageing, is it a double IPA or a great white wine.Thanks Michael for this and all you have done, and our wishes for your complete recovery.

Apple spritzer like flavor from the belgian yeast which accompanies the hoppy citrus rather well with a sour backdrop and nicely carbonated medium dry texture. As much as I dig sour beers, the aftertaste is kind of cloying. The chardonnay is definitely here in the mix. I would love to try this on tap!

Bottle at RBWG Grand Tasting. Pours murky yellow/orange, almost electric orange. Thin white head, very persistent. Nose is nettly, grassy citrus hops, navel orange and grapefruit - herbal notes. Flavours of lemon, tangerine, grassy hops, Champagne-like body/carbonation. Interesting, but I didnt really groove on it....
From a bottle poured an amber color with a good amount of head.  Strong sweet malty flavor with a lasting finish.

Bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours golden with a rich off-white head and a peach aroma. There is a slightly sour fruity flavor with some carbonation and an oaky finish. There is a pleasantly warm alcohol trail. Overall, very complex and tasty.

Capped 750 from Bruisin Ales. Pours hazy orange gold with a creamy yellowish head. Aromas of oak and herb/floral hop. The flavor is fruity, floral vinous and oaky. The fruit suggests light stone fruit - like peach. Touch of pineapple. Damn tasty.

Stellar freaking beer! lightly hazy gold color, white head.  Aroma is loaded with white grapes, hops, yeast, sweet yeast, and spice.  Flavor is a blend of hops, sweet malt, the chardonnay barrels offer such creaminess and yeasty notes, great spice.  Awesome stuff.

First beer of the grand tasting at RBWG 2011 
Appearance: Hazy yellow with a medium white head and good lacing 
Aroma: Tart fruits, Belgian yeast and woody 
Taste: Tart fruits, yeasty, wine barrels, oak with a  dry finish 
Decent

The first beer of the grand tasting, RBWG. Pours a fizzy golden color with a medium white head. A sweet funky vinous wine barrel nose, some Brett, yeasty. The flavor has lost any Hopiness, but is instead a complex vinous, dry and yeasty concoction. Some fruitiness. Very nice.

originally rated the regular HopGod - this is what we actually rated: Really good, if a little schizophrenic. Peppery, spicy aroma, then a a woody note. Flavor is sweet, like honey or something, then a hoppy, pale ale -like note. Some chardonnay mixed in, too. Very tasty stuff.
Dark copper-orange, spotty white cover.  Aroma is fruity, light spicy hoppy.  Taste is fruity again, grape, estery spicing, nice apple sweetness.
# 1900.  Pours a clear orange vistalite with a medium sized off white head.  Aroma of Chardonnay, light oak, fresh citrus and hops.  Taste of Chardonnay notes, oak wood, hops and faint citrus.

Draught at Prohibition Taproom.  Golden copper with a firmly packed white head.  Aroma is sweet malts, light earthy hops, belgian candied malt, light citrus, and a fruity yeast. Medimu bodied with active carbonation.   Flavor is full of citrus bitterness, candied malt, fruity yeast, light booze. Im very anti belgian IPA but this one works it well. Fantastic.

750 ml bottle from Capones.  Pours hazy copper with off-white head.  Nose is resiny hops, tangerine, tropical fruit, oaky and peppery notes.  Tastes fairly dense on the palate, very complex, rich, very hoppy with a huge malt bill, a lot of tropical fruit notes, and some peppery notes.  Very well made as usual from these guys.

Draft at rattle n hum with streets. Pours a bright orange with nice thick haze and no head. Aroma is slightly tart, spices, and woody. Mouthfeel is medium and fairly balanced with notes of light Belgian spices, tart, and oaky notes.dough,

4oz sample @ Rattle N Hum, New York

Sweet, woody IPA. Not very hoppy taste. Dark yellow, small head. Good palate, alcohol warms nicely

750ml Bottle:  Aroma of Belgian yeast, hops, oak, Chardonnay, fruit, hints of peach & pear & apricot & grape, and spices.  Poured orange/amber in color with a large, creamy, dense, off-white head that diminished but lasted throughout.  Hazy.  Very sparkling.  Excellent lacing.  Flavor is medium sweet and heavily bitter.  Tastes of Belgian yeast, hops, oak, white wine, light pine, light Brett, and a hint of vanilla.  Medium body.  Tingly, then dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Heavily bitter, lightly sweet, Belgian yeast, hop, Brett, oak, and slight white wine finish is dry.  10.1%ABV is completely hidden throughout.

Hazy amber/orange color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of yeast, oak, sweet malt, vanilla, & citrus; Flavor of sweet woody malt, yeast, hops, citrus (notably orange), some vanilla, and spice; Finish is dry; Nicely balanced; Overall, rich vinous qualities - very good brew.

Thanks riversideak!  Little oaky chard nose, some spicy belgian yeast.  Sweet bubble gum becomes spicy pepper, good interplay of the wine, little dank toward the finish.  Very tasty beer, missing the hops though.

Woody chardonay notes up front, some belgian yeast esters, light hints of hops - citrus, floral, grass here and there. Pours hazy golden orange, nice head sheets of lace. Chardonay, belgian yeast sweetness, honey, coconut, light hoppy finish. Hides the ten percent well. More belgian than belgo ipa but well done. Fruity finish. Lingering wine barrel.

750ml capped, thanks Alex.  Pours a hazed golden with tight white head and moderate lacing.  Nose is light on the hop aromas, yet balanced with plenty of Belgium esters and as it warms and opens up I pick up light oak and white grapes.  Not much in the way of hops, but digging the barrel and Belgian character.  Slightly boozey as it warms.

Bottle 75cl. @ Papsoes blindtasting. [ Bottle #32. ]Light light unclear medium yellow color with a average to large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, moderate hoppy, citrus - orange, apricot - peach notes. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet and bitter with a long to average duration, sharp orange bitter, fresh. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20100821]

#32 Papsoe Blind tasting 21-08-2010. Large foamy off-white head that  mostly lasted. Good display of lacework. Light cloudy golden color. Aroma of pineapple, peach, mild caramel, hint of citrus and light toasted malt. Medium bodied with a soft carbonation. Light sweet and mild bitter flavor. Fruity finish. 7/3/7/3/15 = 3.5

Bottle at Papsø Blindtasting # 32. Hazy golden body with a creamy white head. Int he aroma is peaches, yeast, sweet ripe fruit and caramel. The flavour is sweet fruit, alcohol, hops and caramel. Full bodied. Long sweet fruity finish.

#32 at papsoes blind tasting
cloudy yellow, smooth fluffy head.
fruity, fruit peel and mild aroma.
flavor is bitter, yellow fruity, fresh

Bottled. Tasted blind # 32 @ Papsoe 21. august 2010. Golden colorued. Unclear. Off white head. aroma: sweetness, fruits, flowers, spice. Flavour: Fruits, grape, herbs, flowers and spice. Meidum bodied. Dry grapy herby and sweet bitterness in the end.

Bottle #32 at Papsøs blindtasting.
Cloudy golden coloured with a medium sized white ehad.
Fruity aroma of spices, yeast and hops with notes of grass and brett.
Fruity flavour of peaches, hops, grass and pine needles with notes of brett.
Dry hopppy finish.

Bottle, blind #32. Pours hazy orange with a small white and lacing head. Aroma is citrusy and mild peachy hops. Mild herbal too. Sweet malty, mild hoppy and vague citrusy. Bitter and dry into a mild herbal and subdued citrusy finish.

Bottle 75 cl.Courtesy of bu11zeye. Pours a cloudy deep golden wit a lacing off-white head. Amazingly exotic hop aroma reminiscent of Sorachi Ace - must be the Chardonnay barrel. Solid body, sweet fruit notes with a yeasty edge. Amazing Chardonnay notes, dry and astringent. An extremely sophisticated and complex beer. 210810

bottle shared by KAN before,  THANKS!  pours  a hazy orange gold.  grassy, herbal hops.  melon booze.  candied sugar.  toasty boozy sweetness.  some light citrus and white grape notes.   seems like a hopopy belgian tripel.  nice vanilla oak layer from the chard barrels.   finishes witha  toasted melon booziness.  good, not great.

750ml bottle thanks to foppa78. Shouldve been shared at rbsg.... Pours a golden hazy orange brown with a medium soapy white head... Aroma of sweet, oak, vanilla and predominantly sweet like the melange but ith some citrus aspects to it... Flavors are of citrusy orange peel hops,
not bitter at all, and totally mellowed by oaky, vanilla, and candied sugar. creamy mouthfeel.
Bottle @ Rattle N Hum. Orange pour with lacing white head. Tart  with some chardonnay, funky hop, citrus and pine notes. Flavor is citrus and pine, and light wine and funk notes.

Bottle. 25.4 oz. Split with James, Fannon, and PJ after Brew Fest. Nice bubbly and vivacious mouthfeel with ripe hop, mellow vanilla, and spices.  Nice quality craft brew... first offering Ive had from Nebraska - nice stuff!   3.65

Bottle. 25.4 oz. Split with James, Andrew, and PJ after Brew Fest. Pours a lively, bubbly gold with a thin, fizzy white head. Aroma of butter, cream, vanilla, honey, toffee, sweet whiskey, and some odd citrus notes. Medium bodied with an insanely velvety, buttery palate. Such a crazy mouthfeel. This reminded me a lot of Allagash Curieux. Great stuff.

Bottle. Moderate aromas all around with cereal for the malt, lemon and flowers for the hops, musty barnyard for the yeast, and toffee and peach in the background. Head is average size, bubbly/frothy/ rocky, with good lacing and legs and is mostly lasting. Flavor starts lightly to moderately sweet and lightly acidic, and finishes lightly to moderately acidic and moderately to heavily bitter.  Palate is medium, almost creamy with a lively carbonation and a moderately alcoholic finish. A very well rounded example of this style with almost perfect balance in the flavor, but the $22 a bottle is a little disappointing and knocked down the overall score a bit.

First rate in awhile. I felt the beer deserved it. A rare re-purchase at $25/750. Aroma seamlessly weaves equal notes of citrus, dough, oak, and fruity chardonnay. Flavor is sweet-fruity up front but develops a complimentary tartness (orangey tartness, not lacto tartness) to balance the sweetness. Bitterness level may be hefty, though it comes across as fairly mild amidst the sweeter notes from the malt, yeast, and chardonnay. Full bodied but not overwhelmed with sticky sugar. Soft carbonation, appropriate with all the subtler fruit notes. Didnt get any funky notes other raters have mentioned. A real winner of a beer from a barrel not often seen in the beer world. Well, well worth it.
750 thanks to Wes. Orange pour. Hops and yeast combine, not in a Chouffe way, but a banana yeasty hoppy way. Some tartness. Fruity flavors. Very interesting.

Bottle thanks to Vtafro for the share, wow 40$ dam.  Pours an amber body with an off white head.  Vinous with white winey notes, chardonnay warming.  A light lemon and pine hop toned body, light sherry with an oakiness and a mild warming.  Decent.

Pours a straw color with s decent white head.  Smells of oak, vanilla, some funk and a decent amount of citrus hops.  Tastes very strong of oak and vanilla.  The funk is still there but the hops dont come through too much.  Overall, a refreshing good beer.

750 ml bottle shared by Vtafro at RNH- $40 a bottle though!  Actually DeCiccos has bottles for $25 so not too steep a markup I suppose?  Pours a slight hazed nice bright yellow gold with a fluffy white head and some lace. Aroma is pretty strong American buttery vanilla and oak, light toasted malts, some chardonnay grapey hints, lemony and citrus hops,  with slight phenolic solvent- some papery oxidation.  Flavor is more wood, oak, vanilla, mixed with chardonnay, light grassy and citrus hops, phenolic Belgian yeast mixed with some slightly stale oxidized malts, some sweet sugary notes and toffee, plasticy phenol, olive brine, old slightly mineral and acidic white wine, and a mostly nice dry lively finish.  Strange beer, some aspects were good, others not so much.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2011 Bottle while at Rattle n Hum. Pours a slightly hazy gold with a strong, fluffy white head. Nose of oak, Belgian yeast, funk, some slight hops. The Belgian funk strikes my palate the most, but there are also some acidic citrus notes - pineapple and orange - along with some wine alcohol flavor. Finish is lightly bitter with some mild tartness, and dry. Medium bodied with average to low carbonation. Pretty nice.

Thanks to Josh for sharing. Pours a lightly hazy golden with a medium bubbly white head that laced.  Aroma of perfume, Chardonnay, floral hops, tropical fruits and orange peel.  Flavor of the same with some oak. Mango coming through.  Love the Belgian Ale meets West Coast IPA thing and what the oak aging did.

holy whatever.....thanks to bu11zeye for this.  man does nebraska know what they are doing when it comes to beer.  now only if the football team could do as good.  ;)  poured yellow with a white head and some lace.  aroma was citrus, oak, and AWESOME!!!  flavor was much the same and for some reason i have notes of bourbon?????  medium body with low carbonation.  this is awesome is all i really should of said.  please send MORE!!!!  i could make a living selling this stuff.

Thank you Josh for sharing this one! 750ml bottle. Poured a medium and hazy golden/amber color with a very large sized off white head. Aromas of funkiness, vanilla, citrus, wood, and some wine. Tastes of the same nice funkiness, oak, vinous, vanilla, and citrus. This one was very good and took me by surprise!
bottle, thanks to bu11zeye, pours a hazy orange gold with white foam, aromas of hoppy yeast and lemon, flavors of oak, pinot grigio, citric, smooth finish

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy orange with a small ring of white head.  Aroma of Belgian yeast, grapefruit, citrus, orange pulp, sweet grapes.  Flavor is sweet and fruity at first and then melds into a pulpy orange finish like you just took a bite out of an orange and got some pulp and rind with it.  Lots of woodsy notes as well, which reminds me a lot of Fred from the Wood.  I cant say I really got the Chardonnay; it just blended with the citrusy, fruity notes.  Quite tasty overall, very impressive coming from a brewery I hadnt heard of before.
7/4/8/4/15 [3.8/5]

(750ml bottle thanks to bu11zeye) pours cloudy yellow orange with nice bubbles. Nose of candi sugar, light hops, Belgian yeast. Taste of earth, Belgian yeast, grass, candi sugar, dandelion with a creamy finish thats well carbonated. A lightly bitter finish to round it out. Both Hop God beers have been quite enjoyable with the nod slightly to the regular version.

Thanks to bu11zeye for sharing this bottle. The beer pours a cloudy golden-orange color with a white head. The aroma is oak and Belgian yeast with some light wine notes. The flavor is Belgian yeast, oak, citrus fruits such as orange and pineapple and a nice bitter finish. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

(750ml bottle)  Pours a hazy golden body with a medium white head.  Aroma of herbs, wood, Belgian yeast, citrus, pineapple, and chardonnay.  Flavor of Belgian yeast, grapefruit, pineapple, herbs, and pine with a bitter, dry wood finish.
Bottle thanks to bu11zeye. Nose is white cheddar, butter, downy, and yeast. Taste is creamy butter and lemon. Lots of chard character.

big thanks to bu11zeye for this bottle.  poured gold with a cream head.  nose was fresh hops, light yeast, wood, and some slight wine notes?  thick on the palate, wood, vanilla, yeast, fresh bitter piney hops, with a light alcohol finish.

Bottle at Rattle n Hum. Poured a medium golden amber with a small foamy head. Nose is hops,apricot, and a hint of wild yeast. So if you had just heard the name of this you would expect another hop bomb, and how wrong i was. As soon as it hit my tongue I said Wow! Apricot and hops and then a hint of sour which led me to think Brett. Do I dare compare this to Temptation? YES! 

 Lightly sour with a wonderful malt base. Some sweet and tart flavors, possibly a good intoduction to sour ale, as the sour notes compliment the hops nicely. The barrel aging really worked well in this example.  Ordered this on a recomendation from Paul the brewer and shared by my new friend Howard. Thanks to both.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2010 Bottle of the Reserve (Chardonnay Barrel) thanks to bu11zeye. Pours with a hazy golden body and a large white head. Aroma of butter, chardonnay barrel, grape and belgian yeast. Flavor comes across quite nicely, wow! Fruity, barrel, tannins, hops, pine, tropical fruit, pineapple. Creamy carbonation, bitter and tannic finish. Very nice.

Had up at Freetail in San Antonio for the Old Bat Rastard bottle release, shared with some awesome BAs from San Antone and Austin and provided by Scott, owner of one of the best brewpubs in Texas, Freetail!

Pours out a light gold with some haze.. foam is sturdy and lacing is ample..

Smell is wonderful, light sweet notes, very light oak, sugar, hints of fresh squeezed hops, and some mellow honey and citrus..

Taste will absolutely blow you away. amazing stuff, from the sturdy hop presence, to the light honey, to the fun yeast/oak flavours; this is just to hard to describe without doing this beer justice! 

not only that but the mouthfeel for a beer of this caliber is untouchable.. smooth as silk, with not even a hint of the 10%.. the abv is hiding so well you should check your pockets..

ALL and all this beer is just amazing..
I want it again and again and drinking it with new friends made it that much better..

I raise my glass!
